name: Potter Kit – Elementor, Beaver Builder, Gutenberg Templates and Elementor Blocks Builder
author: wppotter

sections.description:
Import Potter Theme official themes demo content, widgets and theme settings with just one click.

Get free support

The plugin is a modified version of One Click Demo Importer.

Requirements

  • WordPress 4.7 or later.
  • Potter Official Themes.

Contribute

You can contribute to the source code in our GitHub page.
sections.installation:
1. Install the plugin either via the WordPress.org plugin directory, or by uploading the files to your server (in the /wp-content/plugins/ directory).
  2. Activate the Potter Kit plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.

Automatic installation

Automatic installation is the easiest option as WordPress handles the file transfers itself and you don‚Äôt need to leave your web browser. To do an automatic install of Potter Kit, log in to your WordPress dashboard, navigate to the Plugins menu and click Add New.

In the search field type ‚ÄúPotter Kit‚Äù and click Search Plugins. Once you‚Äôve found our demo importer plugin you can view details about it such as the the point release, rating and description. Most importantly of course, you can install it by simply clicking ‚ÄúInstall Now‚Äù.

Manual installation

The manual installation method involves downloading our demo importer plugin and uploading it to your webserver via your favourite FTP application. The WordPress codex contains instructions on how to do this here.

Updating

Automatic updates should work like a charm; as always though, ensure you backup your site just in case.
sections.faq:
What is the plugin license?

  • This plugin is released under a GPL license.

What themes this plugin supports?

  • The plugin currently only supports Potter themes.

Where can I report bugs or contribute to the project?

Bugs can be reported either in our support forum or preferably on the GitHub repository.

Potter Kit is awesome! Can I contribute?

Yes you can! Join in on our GitHub repository üôÇ
